function.description: A group of statements that perform a task together.

anonymous function.description: A group of statements, without a name, that perform a task together.

local function.description: A group of statements, restricted to a given scope, that perform a task together.

for loop.description: A loop that will execute something for each value of var from exp1 to exp2, using exp3 as the step to increment var.

for pairs loop.description: Returns an iterator function that will iterate over all key-value pairs of the table passed.

for ipairs loop.description: Returns an iterator function that will iterate over all index-value pairs of the table passed.

if condition.description: Executes a block of code if a specific condition is true.

if else condition.description: Executes a block of code if a specific condition is true and all the previous conditions are not met

if not condition.description: Executes a block of code if a specific condition is false.

if not else condition.description: Executes a block of code if a specific condition is false and all the previous conditions are not met.

repeat loop.description: Repeatedly executes a block of code until the condition is met.

while loop.description: Repeatedly executes a block of code while the condition is true.

local variable.description: A variable accessible only within the scope of where it's declared.

table.description: A global table accessible by all scopes wthin the same script.

local table.description: A table accessible only within the scope of where it's declared.

return.description: Returns results or finishes a function.

print.description: Receives any number of arguments, and prints their values to the output.

require.description: Returns what the required ModuleScript returns.

tonumber.description: Attempts to convert the arg into a number with a specified base to interpret the value in. If it cannot be converted, this function returns nil.

tostring.description: Receives an argument of any type and converts it to a string in a reasonable format.

get service.description: Returns a service with the class name requested.

bit32.arshift.description: Returns the number x shifted disp bits to the right.

bit32.band.description: Returns the bitwise and of its operands.

bit32.bnot.description: Returns the bitwise negation of x.

bit32.bor.description: Returns the bitwise or of its operands.

bit32.btest.description: Returns a boolean signalling whether the bitwise and of its operands is different from zero.

bit32.bxor.description: Returns the bitwise exclusive or of its operands.

bit32.extract.description: Returns the unsigned number formed by the bits field to field + width - 1 from n.

bit32.lrotate.description: Returns the number x rotated disp bits to the left.

bit32.lshift.description: Returns the number x shifted disp bits to the left.

bit32.rrotate.description: Returns the number x rotated disp bits to the right.

bit32.rshift.description: Returns the number x shifted disp bits to the right

coroutine.create.description: Creates a new coroutine, with body f. f must be a Lua function.

coroutine.resume.description: Starts or continues the execution of the coroutine passed. The first time you resume a coroutine, it starts running its body.

coroutine.status.description: Returns the status of coroutine co. Statuses that may be returned are 'running', 'suspended', 'normal', or 'dead'.

coroutine.wrap.description: Creates a new coroutine, with body f. f must be a Lua function. Returns a function that resumes the coroutine each time it is called.

coroutine.yield.description: Suspends the execution of the calling coroutine. Any arguments to yield are passed as extra results to resume.

debug.traceback.description: Returns a traceback of the current function call stack as a string.

math.abs.description: Returns the absolute value of x.

math.acos.description: Returns the arc cosine of x.

math.asin.description: Returns the arc sine of x.

math.atan.description: Returns the arc tangent of x (in radians).

math.atan2.description: Returns the arc tangent of y/x (in radians), but uses the signs of both parameters to find the quadrant of the result.

math.ceil.description: Returns the smallest integer larger than or equal to x.

math.clamp.description: Returns a number between min and max, inclusive.

math.cos.description: Returns the cosine of x (assumed to be in radians).

math.cosh.description: Returns the hyperbolic cosine of x.

math.deg.description: Returns the angle x (given in radians) in degrees.

math.floor.description: Returns the largest integer smaller than or equal to x.

math.fmod.description: Returns the remainder of the division of x by y that rounds the quotient towards zero.

math.frexp.description: Returns m and e such that x = m*2^e, e is an integer and the absolute value of m is in the range [0.5, 1).

math.ldexp.description: Returns m*2^e (e should be an integer).

math.log.description: Returns the logarithm of x using the given base, or the mathematical constant e if no base is provided (natural logarithm).

math.log10.description: Returns the base-10 logarithm of x.

math.max.description: Returns the maximum value among the numbers passed to the function.

math.min.description: Returns the minimum value among the numbers passed to the function.

math.modf.description: Returns two numbers, the integral part of x and the fractional part of x.

math.noise.description: Returns a perlin noise value between -1 and 1.

math.pow.description: Returns x^y. (You can also use the expression x^y to compute this value.)

math.rad.description: Returns the angle x (given in degrees) in radians.

math.random.description: Returns a random number random numbers in the range [m, n].

math.randomseed.description: Sets x as the seed for the pseudo-random generator: equal seeds produce equal sequences of numbers.

math.sign.description: Returns -1 if x < 0, 0 if x == 0, or 1 if x > 0.

math.sin.description: Returns the sine of x (assumed to be in radians).

math.sinh.description: Returns the hyperbolic sine of x.

math.sqrt.description: Returns the square root of x. (You can also use the expression x^0.5 to compute this value.)

math.tan.description: Returns the tangent of x (assumed to be in radians).

math.tanh.description: Returns the hyperbolic tangent of x.

math.huge.description: The value HUGE_VAL, a value larger than or equal to any other numerical value.

os.time.description: Returns how many seconds have elapsed since the UNIX epoch (1 January 1970, 00:00:00), under UTC time.

os.difftime.description: Returns the number of seconds from t1 to t2.

os.date.description: Returns a table containing the components of a given time. The formatString must be either "*t" (local time) or "!*t" (UTC time).

string.byte.description: Returns the internal numerical codes of the characters s[i], s[i+1], …, s[j]. The default value for i is 1; the default value for j is i.

string.char.description: Returns a string with length equal to the number of arguments, in which each character has the internal numerical code equal to its corresponding argument.

string.find.description: Looks for the first match of pattern in the string s. If it finds a match, then find returns the indices of s where this occurrence starts and ends; otherwise, it returns nil.

string.format.description: Returns a formatted version of its variable number of arguments following the description given in its first argument.

string.gmatch.description: Returns an iterator function that, each time it is called, returns the next captures from pattern over the string s.

string.gsub.description: Returns a copy of s in which all (or the first n, if given) occurrences of the pattern have been replaced by a replacement string specified by repl, which can be a string, a table, or a function. gsub also returns, as its second value, the total number of matches that occurred.

string.len.description: Receives a string and returns its length.

string.lower.description: Receives a string and returns a copy of this string with all uppercase letters changed to lowercase.

string.match.description: Looks for the first match of pattern in the string s. If a match is found, it is returned; otherwise, it returns nil. A third, optional numerical argument init specifies where to start the search; its default value is 1 and can be negative.

string.rep.description: Returns a string that is the concatenation of n copies of the string s.

string.reverse.description: Returns a string that is the string s reversed.

string.split.description: Splits a string into parts based on the defined separator character(s), returning a table of ordered results.

string.sub.description: Returns the substring of s that starts at i and continues until j; i and j can be negative. If j is absent, then it is assumed to be equal to -1 (which is the same as the string length).

string.upper.description: Receives a string and returns a copy of this string with all lowercase letters changed to uppercase. All other characters are left unchanged.

table.concat.description: Given an array where all elements are strings or numbers, returns the string t[i] … sep … t[i+1] … sep … t[j]. The default value for sep is an empty string.

table.foreach.description: Iterates over the provided table, passing the key and value of each iteration over to the provided function.

table.foreachi.description: Iterates over the provided table, passing the index and value of each iteration over to the provided function.

table.getn.description: Returns the number of elements in the table passed.

table.insert.description: Appends the provided value to the end of the array unless pos is specified.

table.remove.description: Removes from array t the element at position pos, returning the value of the removed element.

table.sort.description: Sorts elements of array t in a given order, from t[1] to t[#t]. If comp is given, then it must be a function that accepts two elements.

table.pack.description: Returns a new table with all arguments stored into keys 1, 2, etc. and with a field “n” with the total number of arguments.

table.unpack.description: Returns the elements from the given list.

table.move.description: Moves elements from table a1 to table a2.

table.create.description: Creates a table with the array portion allocated to the given number of elements, optionally filled with the given value.

table.find.description: Within the given array-like table haystack, find the first occurrence of value needle, starting from index init or the beginning if not provided. If the value is not found, nil is returned.

utf8.char.description: Receives zero or more codepoints as integers, converts each one to its corresponding UTF-8 byte sequence and returns a string with the concatenation of all these sequences.

utf8.codes.description: Returns an iterator function that will iterate over all codepoints in str.

utf8.codepoint.description: Returns the codepoints (as integers) from all codepoints in the provided string (str) that start between byte positions i and j (both included).

utf8.len.description: Returns the number of UTF-8 codepoints in the string str that start between positions i and j.

utf8.offset.description: Returns the position (in bytes) where the encoding of the n-th codepoint of s (counting from byte position i) starts.

utf8.graphemes.description: Returns an iterator function that will iterate the grapheme clusters of str.

utf8.nfcnormalize.description: Converts the input string to Normal Form C, which tries to convert decomposed characters into composed characters.

utf8.nfdnormalize.description: Converts the input string to Normal Form D, which tries to break up composed characters into decomposed characters.

utf8.charpattern.description: Matches exactly zero or more UTF-8 byte sequence, assuming that the subject is a valid UTF-8 string.
